definition: currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)

sentences.english: That is the anchor of the New Era.
sentences.chinese: 那兒就是新紀元的錨定之處。

sentences.english: Practice The invention of machinery had brought into the world a new era --- the Industrial Age.
sentences.chinese: 機器的發明使世界進入了一個新紀元即工業時代。

sentences.english: "Vino Nobile" is the starter series into the world of beverage-specific glasses.
sentences.chinese: “諾柏酒杯”開創了世界上飲料特效杯的新紀元。

sentences.english: Direct access to the full glory of a new era.
sentences.chinese: 直達光輝燦爛的新紀元。

sentences.english: It should have been the beginning of a fruitful new era.
sentences.chinese: 這本應是一個成功紀元的開始。

sentences.english: Thus, the new era of Rikulau 953 begins.
sentences.chinese: 也因而展開了953的新紀元。

sentences.english: No one paid much attention to the end of Baktun 13 until fairly recently.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近纔有人注意第13白克頓紀元的結束。

sentences.english: The water compartment vessel ushered in a new epoch of ocean shipping.
sentences.chinese: 水密隔艙海船開闢了人類遠洋航海的新紀元。

sentences.english: We have entered upon a new phase in history.
sentences.chinese: 我們已開始了歷史的新紀元。

sentences.english: Now we're in the Common Era,so this 66 CE.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們講到了公曆紀元，所以是公元66年。

sentences.english: Really the next day , the Minister, the Minister fell off the horse ahd died .
sentences.chinese: 真的第二天，部長，部長跌下來死馬新紀元。

sentences.english: The new age of travel is also sturdily democratic.
sentences.chinese: 旅遊的新紀元同時也是十分民主的紀元。

sentences.english: The new age of travel is also sturdily democratic.
sentences.chinese: 旅遊的新紀元同時也是十分民主的紀元。

sentences.english: J. h. lambert initiated a new epoch in the theoretical cartography .
sentences.chinese: 蘭伯特在理論製圖學方面開創了一個新紀元。

sentences.english: The return of Asia to the world stage will define the era.
sentences.chinese: 亞洲迴歸世界舞臺將是劃紀元的一舉。

sentences.english: It marks the beginning of a new era in human history.
sentences.chinese: 這標誌着人類歷史新紀元的開始。

definition: the Yellow Emperor, mythological emperor of China, reigned c. 2697-2597 BC
to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate
Jiaqing Emperor (1760-1820), seventh Qing emperor, personal name 顒琰|颙琰[Yong2 yan3], reigned 1796-1820
in the years of/during those years/period (of dynasty or decade)
Yongle Emperor, reign name of third Ming emperor Zhu Di 朱棣[Zhu1 Di4] (1360-1424), reigned 1403-1424, Temple name 明成祖[Ming2 Cheng2 zu3]
